Self-Deprecation is Overrated

Jan 5, 2011

Self-deprecation is good as a joke, in small bursts, and when it's meant to be funny. Generally, the best way to put people at ease when they expect that you're about to be full of yourself is to make a joke at your own expense.But it only really works when it's honest. Too often, people will use a self-deprecating remark in an effort to cloak their ego. They willingly take a stab at themselves, but...

Video Killed the Radio-haters, Too

Jan 3, 2011

In the past, I've harbored plenty of resentment towards television, but I have trouble doing this now. If you look at the trends, there was clearly an explosion in television-watching around the same time that TV sets became widely available. This looks bad; it makes it seem that TV consumption supplanted a lot of other more important and intellectual pursuits. Perhaps it left us worse off.But the rise in television watching coincides, I believe, with...

He just had to drop something to the ground in front of him. "That's gravity." And they believed him. Jan 1, 2011

The Engineer

Dec 30, 2010

The Google results page was actually display results from Yahoo!, formatted to look like Google results, and vice versa. The question was posed: which gave you better results?The answer was about what you would expect. Now, if you visit the Googleplex and...

Minus

Dec 28, 2010

Some brilliant person discovered that Garfield is a whole lot more profound, entertaining, and funny if you just remove Garfield from it entirely.It's a judicious use of a less commonly used operator. Improve by taking away, not adding.
